body.name: Dell 2023 Newest Inspiron 15 3525 Laptop, 15.6" FHD Display, AMD Ryzen 5 5500U Processor up to 4GHz, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD, AMD Radeon Graphics, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Windows 11 Home
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by Best Deal Electronic.
features: 【Processor】AMD Ryzen 5 5500U (up to 4GHz) brings the perfect combination of features to make you unstoppable. With 6 cores and 12 threads are ready to handle all your work.

【Upgraded】Up to 64GB DDR4 RAM significantly increases performance, and up to 2TB SSD has no moving parts, resulting in faster start-up times and data access, no noise, and reduced heat production and power draw on the battery.

【Display】With the 15.6-inch IPS display, your entertainment just got pushed to the very edge. Get expansive, 1920 x 1080 (Full HD) resolution, vibrant images with awesome colors, and intuitively control your PC right from the screen.

【Graphics】Smoothly stream content and play your favorite games with AMD Radeon Graphics. Impressive performance for creating, gaming, and entertainment. A new level of graphics performance and crisp, stunning visuals – with the convenience of a thin and light laptop.
【Windows 11 Home】From a rejuvenated Start menu, to new ways to connect to your favorite people, news, games, and content, Windows 11 Home is the place to think, express, and create in a natural way.
body.description: Statement: Original Seal is opened for upgrade ONLY. If the computer has modifications, then the manufacturer box is opened for it to be tested and inspected and to install the upgrades to achieve the specifications as advertised.Brand: DellProduct Name: Dell Inspiron 15 3525 LaptopProcessor Manufacturer: AMDOperating System: Windows 11 HomeProcessor Model: AMD Ryzen 5 5500UProcessor Core: 6 CoresProcessor Speed: Up to 4GHzGraphics: AMD Radeon GraphicsGPU Brand: AMDGraphics Type: IntegratedScreen Size: 15.6 inchesScreen Resolution: 1920 x 1080 (Full HD)Type of Memory (RAM): DDR4Memory: Up to 64GB DDR4 RAMStorage Type: SSDHard Drive: Up to 2TB SSDWireless Connectivity: Bluetooth, Wi-FiHeadphone Jack: TrueBuilt-In Microphone: TrueFront-Facing Camera: TrueColor: BlackPorts:1 x HDMI 1.41 x USB 3.2 Type-A 1 x USB 3.2 Type-C1 x USB 2.01 x Headphone/Microphone ComboDimensions: 14.11" x 9.27" x 0.83"Weight: 3.71 pounds

reviews.reviewText: This laptop was supposed to have 1TB of memory. It only showed 100 GB. After contacting Dell for help, they advised me to return the laptop. It was returned in the timeframe and in working order, however they charged me a 56% restocking fee. UNHEARD OF!!! Do not buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Bon écran utilisé en gaming ( cf mon profil)Le g Sync fonctionne bien, tester avec plusieurs carte graphique.Les touche sont facilement accessibles, et vous pouvez en personnaliser deux, perso j ai mis la luminosité sur l une pour pouvoir la changer rapidement.Après 5 ans d utilisation je ne regrette pas mon achat.Je l ai acheté un poil cher a l époque.

Ho provato questo monitor 27 pollici, 144Hz e 2K per 6 mesi ed è stata un'esperienza stupenda, il G-sync funziona alla perfezione, imput-lag inesistente questo perchè è un monitor TN con 1ms di risposta che non ha nulla da inviadiare a quelli IPS. Desing semplice ed elegante e la quasi totale mancanza di bordature, rendono molto piacevole l'interfaccia con questa periferica, per niente stancante anche dopo lunghe sessioni di gaming.Non punto il dito contro nessuno, però la confezione è arrivata danneggiata, non sembrava un danno così importante da spingermi alla sostituzione, però dopo 6 mesi è apparsa una linea verticale viola che mi ha costretto alla restituzione. Il servizio assistenza clienti Amazon è stato impeccabile come sempre.Anche se nel mio caso c'è stato questo contrattempo diciamo di natura "tecnica", rimango dell'opinione che il monitor è valido e vale la pena comprarlo perchè non ha niente da invidiare ad altre marche, risparmiando anche qualcosa a parità di prestazioni. Cosigliato

reviews.reviewTitle: Monitor muy versátil y de mucha calidad
reviews.reviewText: Es una pasada de monitor gamer. El mío es la revisión A3.Cansado ya de los colores de mi antiguo Asus VG248QE, al principio pensaba en un IPS, pero tras investigar los problemas que tienen y ver los precios, volví a investigar los paneles TN. Se hablaba muy bien de este monitor, que por cierto es poco conocido, pero no fue hasta que lo vi con mis propios ojos que entendí que hay paneles TN y PANELES TN. Esto es una maravilla, los colores no tienen nada que ver con mi monitor antiguo, no sufren ninguna degradación al ir subiendo la frecuencia y con un perfil ICC (imprescindible ponérselo) es una delicia para los ojos, más que suficiente a no ser que te dediques muy profesionalmente a fotografía, edición gráfica y demás. Unos negros geniales y el blanco muy homogéneo. Los ángulos de visión son los típicos de un buen TN, pero para mí ningún problema con esto.Con la resolución 2560x1440 y esta calidad, es una gozada para las tareas típicas, navegar por internet y demás, pero por supuesto donde se le saca partido es con videojuegos. Os podéis imaginar, entre la resolución, los colores, el tamaño, nada de lag... es una maravilla. El G-Sync se nota bastante, por ejemplo con juegos de coches todos los movimientos son mucho más suaves y sin tirones que con mi antiguo Asus, parece como grabado con una cámara más que un videojuego, todo es fluido independientemente de si es complicada o no la escena, es una senación muy agradable. También lo he usado para edición fotográfica a nivel aficionado y ya os digo, la fidelidad de los colores es muy buena para no ser un monitor dedicado profesionalmente a ello, de sobra para cualquier persona normal, y el tamaño y la resolución son geniales para visualizar fotos de alta resolución.Físicamente hablando, viene muy bien embalado y es fácil de montar. La estética está trabajada, es elegante. El marco no sobresale del plano de la pantalla y es muy fino, quedando muy chulo. Se puede regular en altura, en ángulo, rotar en el plano vertical (girar la pantalla para ponerla en formato vertical) y rotar en el plano horizontal (girarlo sobre la base). Base estable y elegante. El monitor no hace ruido eléctrico ni nada raro. Los menús y sus botones no son lo mejor del mundo, pero tampoco es algo que uso mucho. Tuve la maña suerte de tener un pixel muerto, aunque con tanta resolución es difícil verlo. Incluye cable usb 3.0 (tiene puertos en la propia pantalla) y cable DP bastante largo.La verdad es que estoy muy contento con la relación calidad-precio. Es todo lo que puedo necesitar, gastarse más son ya o monitores muy profesionales o cosas como el "quiero y no puedo" que está ocurriendo con los IPS gamer. Este monitor está muy currando y aunque no incluye nada super revolucionario tiene muy pulido todo lo que había existía hasta ahora. Es pura calidad, lo compras y a disfrutar, no te va a dar ningún problema. Eso sí, fundamental descargarse un perfil ICC de internet (yo tengo un calibrador, pero tengo que admitir que el resultado no cambia casi nada comparando con los perfiles de internet) porque sería una pena no tenerlo funcionando al 100 %

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 30, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: Brilliant monitor, excels in both the big features and the smaller ones.
reviews.reviewText: A few points to note before I go into this review:- I only have experience of TN panel monitors, so I'm not going to be able to compare it to IPS or any other form of display currently available.- I bought this monitor after refunding an ASUS ROG PG248Q, which was faulty on arrival with backlight bleed and suffered stuck pixels (surprise surprise).- This monitor (at least the one I was given) is the latest revision, the A03 (assembled in June 2016).Anyway, this is a fantastic monitor, that I highly recommend for anyone with the PC hardware to get the most out of it. I did a lot of research before going for this monitor, and I feel that a lot of reviews (both professional and consumers) don't talk about the smaller positives of this monitor over its competitor, so i'm going to try to include those too.For reference, these are the important PC specs I run for this monitor and gameplay at 1440p.- CPU: i5 4690K, overclocked to 4.5Ghz and watercooled.- GPU: MSI GTX 1070 Gaming X 8GB.- RAM: 16GB, 2400Mhz HyperX Fury.- PSU: 850W EVGA 80+ Gold.PROS:- Stunning image quality. Going from 24" 1080p to 27" 1440p is like going from a TV to a cinema screen. Honestly the increased resolution makes everything on the screen really pop. From just your desktop wallpaper to games it is a real visual revolution. In games such as Hitman and GTA V I sometimes feel I could reach out and touch things on the screen, it just has such a high visual clarity. Also, in terms of desktop space, if you come from 1080p, you'll have so much space you won't know what to do with most of it!- G-Sync is a thing of beauty. Honestly I was skeptical as to what G-Sync really did, and you can read as many reviews as you like, but you won't truly understand its advantages until you have it. Ever have those moments in games when the game can hitch or stutter briefly, maybe when you're moving at high speeds or heading into new areas? I had those...until G-Sync came along and eliminated them. Period. G-Sync will also smooth over that transition to 1440p, you may drop to 40-50fps at times in intensive games, but G-Sync will make it almost unnoticeable.- 144hz needs to become the new standard. You may think that 60hz is all you'll ever need, afterall 60fps is what we mainly aim for in game performance. However, 144hz just gives that butter smooth feel to everything, and it doesn't need to be games. Even just browsing the web or navigating your desktop, the 144hz makes mouse movements glide, and feel super responsive. Going back to 60hz, you can notice that loss in smoothness. 144fps in games is not as revolutionary, but in some situations you can feel that smooth movement here and there.- The monitors build quality is fantastic. Every piece of the monitor is sturdy, and you can feel that quality to each piece, from the base, the stand through to the panel itself. The thin bezel around the display is very sleek and minimalist, the stand is easily assembled, no tools required. No part of this monitor really feels flimsy. There is a small issue with the buttons, but i'll get to that in cons.- The stand is minimalist and not over-designed. Going from the ASUS ROG Swift variety of monitor, I can categorically say that ASUS are trying too hard to be edgy or gamer-y. The ROG Swift stand is all angular for no reason, the red LED ring around the stand is more of a distraction than something appealing (I turned it off for the short time I had it), and the stand that holds the monitor itself is built like an over sized tree trunk. I have my monitors slightly higher than where I sit, and so I have to set the monitor to lie a little lower on its vertical axis. With the ASUS this meant that the giant tree trunk stand stuck out over the back and it was really unappealing. With the DELL, the stand is minimalist, easy to adjust and keeps itself hidden as much as it can. It looks 100x better on a desktop than an ASUS Swift does. I applaud DELL for making a gaming monitor that remains clean and understated in its design, this edgy gaming design that ASUS and ACER are pursuing is (in my opinion) a bit of an insult, as it makes gamers seem like we are kids that like flashy lights and think that Michael Bay's Transformers are the best thing ever.- This monitor needs no external power bricks. Unlike the ASUS PG248Q which I had, this monitor (which is bigger and has the same features) does not have any external power brick to worry about when wiring it up. It uses a simple kettle style power lead and therefore much easier to wire up and fit into any tight spaces.- Quality Control, Quality Control. Buying an ASUS monitor (which in the case of gaming monitors is the big competitor, alongside ACER) IS a lottery. You might think that the QC lottery idea has been inflated and exaggerated by the internet, and that it wont happen to you. I also thought that, but lo-and-behold, I have bought 1 ASUS ROG Swift monitor and I have had that 1 monitor be faulty. These monitors are expensive, they are a big investment for us and to have such poor QC is unforgivable in my opinion. As I have previously mentioned the PG248Q I had (which is a brand new line from ASUS) had backlight bleed and suffered from stuck pixels straight out of the box. In comparison, I have only needed to have 1 DELL S2716DG sent to me, and it has been perfect from day one. Every monitor has the chance to go wrong, but in the case of ASUS ROG Swift monitors I would say you're more likely to have a faulty one than a perfect one from the box.- If you (like me) are doing a direct comparison between the S2716DG and the ASUS PG278Q and are weighing up some of the differences, connectivity can be an important factor. The ASUS PG278Q only gives you a single DP port, whereas this monitor offers a little more flexibility in giving you 1 DP port and 1 HDMI port. Though as other reviews will remind you, you must use the DP port to take advantage of 144hz and G-Sync.- In reference to the anti-glare, that some people bring up when speaking of this monitor. I do not notice any of it. Maybe I don't have the hawk eyes that some people do, or maybe its because I play in a fairly dimly lit room, but I see no issue with it whatsoever.- Colours. This part of a monitor (in my opinion) is completely subjective. Everyone has their preferences to how they like to view colours. I personally do not enjoy colours being too dark, or rich if that's the better word. I like to be able to pick out details in shadows and darker areas of games. For me, this monitor gives me amazing colours. As I stated to begin with I have never used IPS so I cannot compare, but from the experiences of a BENQ 1080p monitor I moved from, and the ASUS ROG PG248Q I used for a while, this monitor is in a different league for colours. Everything looks brilliant and I havn't even messed with any colour settings or profiles. I will not give much else on this topic as like I said, its a subjective topic that everyone will have their own preferences for.- Pixel Inversion. I had to look up what this was when I read reviews about the monitor, and even now that I know what it is, I can safely say that this monitor does not have it. At least I can't ever see it.CONS:- The power button is a little fiddly, more fiddly than maybe most people would appreciate. Because it is more or less flush with the underside of the monitor it requires a bit of extra pressure to click. This usually means that you need to place a finger or two on top of the monitor to counteract the action of pushing up. This is one area where ASUS do have a win, their power and OSD buttons are much easier to operate.- The glossy black finish to the rear of the monitor is not the best choice ever, but its also one that is vastly common in monitors (my BENQ monitors are glossy black all over for example). I would have preferred matte black all around, but it is at least matte black on the front, which is the really important part after all.- You DO need a computer with some umph behind it. If you're running a older CPU or GPU (even a single GTX 970) I would not reccomend the jump to 1440p. A good CPU with a decent overclock, strong RAM and at least a GTX 1070 are what I would say is the minimum to get the juicy visuals at the higher resolution. However, don't feel that you need a GTX 1080 or more to get the goods at 1440p. I personally was worried about performance with my PC at 1440p, but so far its been excellent.Here are some approximate examples to give you an idea:- Witcher 3 (1440p, Ultra (Grass density distance on High), Hairworks ON) - 58-72+fps- GTA V (1440p, Mix of Ultra-Very High, 4x MSAA) - 55-70+fps- Deus Ex Mankind Divided (1440p, Ultra, No MSAA its a broken setting anyway) - 45-70fps (this game has not got the greatest track record for optimization right now).- Overwatch (1440p, Epic, Everything switched on) - 70-100fps- Hitman 2016 (1440p, Highest settings minus turning down Shadow maps one notch) - 45-100fps (this game again has wild up and down results depending on where you are, even at 1080p....but G-Sync has your back, you wont notice it much at all).- Rocket League (1440p, Everything switched on) - 144fps- Deus Ex Human Revolution (1440p, DX11, Everything switched on) - 230-300+fps (just for fun :P)Overall, this is a great monitor. A superior piece of kit to the ASUS ROG Swift competitor in my opinion, and I think that is an opinion shared by a lot of people who went for this monitor over ASUS. I can tell you from personal experience that I felt a lot more confident in my purchase of this monitor than I did buying the ASUS, and my confidence was rewarded.Purchasing a monitor (especially at this price range) is a big decision, but I hope that this review will get people a bit more in the know of the big positives and some of the smaller ones that make this monitor a great choice!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente monitor. El G-Sync es un espectáculo!!
reviews.reviewText: Me dejé llevar por las opiniones de los demás compradores y me decidí a comprar este monitor. Llevo dos dias con él y estoy encantado. Me alegro mucho con la compraLo que más me está gustando es el G-Sync. De verdad, hay que verlo en vivo para apreciar lo bueno que es.En cuanto a que es un panel TN, os cuento que yo tenía un monitor Samsung con panel VA de 1080p a 60hz y en cuanto a colores, una vez calibrado apenas noto la diferencia. La resolución teniendo una tele 4K la verdad es que no impresiona tanto. Lo que sí se nota y muchísimo son los 144hz. Me están gustando tanto que estoy pensando vender mi 1070 para pillarme una 1080ti y aprovechar asíel refresco de pantalla y poder jugar todo a más de 100fps.En cuanto a la estética, es un monitor sobrio, sin colores llamativos o leds RGB, pero a mí eso me gusta. También me ha llamado la atención los bordes que son muy finos, tanto que con el monitor apagado te tienes que acercar para saber donde termina la pantalla.La calidad de los materiales es buena, no es premium, ya que casi todo es plástico pero se nota resistente.La peana es cómoda de manejar, va suave para subir y bajar.Lo único negativo que podría ponerle es el precio, algo elevado para ser un panel TN. Yo lo he comprado rebajado a 615€ Así que tampoco es una locura de precio. Más de 700€ si que me parecería una mala compra porque por 750€ tienes paneles IPS.En conclusión, recomiendo mucho este monitor. Tal vez los de panel IPS se vean mejor, según dicen porque yo no he probado ninguno. Pero con respecto al VA están muy a la par.
